title: GM's electric vehicles will gain access to Tesla's charging network
description: Also under an agreement between the two companies GM will adopt Tesla's connector, the plug that links an electric vehicle to a charging station. Ford recently made a similar announcement with Tesla.

title: Spare a thought for Gustavo, the guy delivering your ramen in the wildfire smoke
description: As most New Yorkers isolated inside this week to avoid the hazardous smoke that enveloped the city, one man was rushing ramen across town for a customer's dinner.

title: Guam is still recovering from Typhoon Mawar, but residents are taking it in stride
description: The U.S. territory is home to more than 170,000 residents in the western Pacific Ocean. Guam was walloped by a power typhoon in late May and the recovery is slow going as power and water are restored.

title: FDA advisers endorse new RSV antibody drug for babies
description: A panel of experts to the Food and Drug Administration has recommended the agency approve a long-acting antibody drug that can protect infants from the seasonal virus, RSV.

title: DeSantis campaign shares apparent AI-generated fake images of Trump and Fauci
description: It's the latest example of how generative AI tools enable politicians to blur the line between fact and fiction.

title: 'I still hate LIV': Golf's civil war is over, but how will pro golfers move on?
description: "I still hate LIV. Like, I hate it. I hope it goes away," Rory McIlroy, the world's no. 3 player, said of the new deal between the PGA Tour and the Saudi fund behind LIV.

title: El Niño has officially begun. Here's what that means for the U.S.
description: The natural climate pattern known as El Niño has officially begun. It exacerbates human-caused climate change, driving even hotter temperatures and other dangerous weather.

title: When will air quality improve? A lot is riding on the wind
description: Millions of Americans are under air quality alerts as wildfires burn in Canada. Experts say the weather pattern could change by early next week, and stress the need to take precautions until then.

title: Seismic stations detected explosion at Ukrainian dam around the time it collapsed
description: A Norwegian organization says that two seismic networks it oversees saw an explosion at the Kakhovka dam around the time it failed.

title: Humans traveled less during COVID restrictions. Animals traveled more
description: Animals being tracked by scientists tended to travel longer distances in the early months of the pandemic, when people stayed home. The wildlife also ventured closer to roads.

title: A lesson Parkland shooting survivor David Hogg learned: Find the joy
description: David Hogg is a survivor of the 2018 mass shooting at his high school. He talks about advocacy, finding common ground with opponents and the importance of making time for joy amid the pain.

title: Octopuses tweak the RNA in their brains to adjust to warmer and cooler waters
description: The California two-spot octopus can edit the RNA in its brain to produce different proteins as ocean temperatures fluctuate, a new study finds.

title: Supreme Court sides with Jack Daniel's in trademark dispute with dog toy maker
description: Jack Daniel's, the famous Tennessee whiskey company, tried to stop production and marketing of a dog toy shaped and decorated like a Jack Daniel's bottle but with the name "Bad Spaniels" on the label.

title: 4 young children are critically wounded in a knife attack in a French Alpine town
description: As bystanders screamed for help, a man with a knife stabbed four young children at a lakeside park in the French Alps. The children suffered life-threatening injuries, and two adults were wounded.

title: Wade Goodwyn, longtime NPR correspondent, dies at age 63
description: Wade Goodwyn had one of public radio's most recognizable voices but it was his rich writing and keen observations that made him a listener favorite over decades at NPR.

title: Asian Americans are at high risk for diabetes. Here's what can help
description: Asian Americans and Pacific Islanders often develop diabetes at lower weights and younger ages than others. Doctors from these communities are pushing for earlier screenings and lifestyle changes.

title: Supreme Court unexpectedly upholds provision prohibiting racial gerrymandering
description: The Supreme Court has ruled against Alabama's defense of an electoral map drawn by the state's Republican-dominated legislature. Black voters had challenged the law as racially discriminatory.

title: Pat Robertson, televangelist and a leader of the religious right, dies at 93
description: Pat Robertson founded the Christian Broadcasting Network. He also hosted The 700 Club and drew controversy for comments that were often seen as anti-gay and racially insensitive.

title: In his 1st White House visit, Rishi Sunak talks Ukraine, AI — and how to say his name
description: After Boris Johnson, Brexit and political turmoil, British Prime Minister Rishi Sunak wants to convey stability in his first trip to the White House. On the agenda: Ukraine, NATO and AI.

title: China's scientist scorned for baby gene editing is out of jail and back in the lab
description: He Jiankui, who shocked the world in 2018 by announcing the creation of the first gene-edited babies, tells NPR he's now working on a cure for Duchenne muscular dystrophy.

title: 'The Talk' is an epic portrait of an artist making his way through hardships
description: Despite its weighty, multi-tiered approach — this is not, on multiple levels, an easy read — Darrin Bell's debut graphic memoir is difficult to put down.

title: Book bans are on the rise. Biden is naming a point person to address that
description: Book bans in schools can violate federal civil rights laws if they create a hostile environment for students. The Education Department will have a new point person to talk to schools about bans.

title: How to stay safe from the smoke that's spreading from the Canadian wildfires
description: From particulate matter to the AQI, here's what you need to know to protect yourself as the smoky haze settles over much of the East Coast.

title: K-9 dogs have long been seen as impartial. Now police bodycams hold them accountable
description: Police body cameras have increased accountability for K-9 units, making it easier for defendants to claim unconstitutional searches. A federal lawsuit in Texas illustrates the new dynamic.

title: Senators to announce coalition reaches $1 billion goal for minority, community lending
description: Sens. Mark Warner, D-Va., and Mike Crapo, R-Idaho, will join Treasury Deputy Secretary Wally Adeyemo at the Capitol Thursday to announce the funding.

title: South Korean inquiry to look into more foreign adoptions with suspect origins
description: The new cases in the expanded inquiry into South Korea's foreign adoption boom involve adoptees in 11 nations including the U.S., Denmark, Norway, and Sweden who were adopted from 1960 to 1990.

title: Hawaii's Mount Kilauea volcano has erupted again. Watch it live
description: Lava began erupting at the Halemaʻumaʻu crater and reached heights of 13 to 30 feet and covered an area of approximately 370 acres. The biggest threat to those in the area is volcanic gas.
